item.title: Ludlow - Wikipedia
item.description: Ludlow (/ ˈlʌdloʊ / LUD-loh) is a market town and civil parish in south Shropshire, England. It is located 28 miles (45 km) south of Shrewsbury and 23 miles (37 km) north of Hereford, on the A49 road which bypasses the town. The town is near the confluence of the rivers Corve and Teme.

item.title: Ludlow | Historic Town, Colonial Era, River Valley | Britannica
item.description: It is located on the Chicopee River, just northeast of Springfield. Settled about 1751, it was known as Stony Hill until 1774, when it was renamed (probably for Ludlow, England) and incorporated, becoming set off from Springfield because of difficulties in crossing the river between the two places.
